data.text:
Quick Guides

Adding a custom logo to your site‚Äôs header is one of the very first things you‚Äôll probably want to do after you‚Äôve set up your site on your new host and installed a theme you like. Luckily, it‚Äôs also one of the simplest things you can do in WordPress. Here‚Äôs how to make it happen:

Log in to your WordPress dashboard.

Select ‚ÄúCustomize‚Äù from the drop down menu under ‚ÄúAppearance‚Äù.

Select the menu option for ‚ÄúHeader‚Äù or ‚ÄúLogo‚Äù settings. The options available in the customizer are not standard throughout WordPress and are determined by the theme developer. You might have to search a bit to find section in your theme that allows for customizations. Here are a couple examples of what you‚Äôre looking for:

Once you‚Äôve found the area that controls your header, click ‚ÄúSelect Image‚Äù.

Click ‚ÄúSelect Files‚Äù to upload the image file you want to use as your header logo. Then click ‚ÄúChoose Image‚Äù.

Once you have a logo that looks the way you want it to in the preview to the right, click ‚ÄúSave‚Äù and that‚Äôs it!
